verses.verse: It will be (Job 20:24; Is. 24:17, 18; Jer. 48:44) as though a man fled from a lion, And a bear met him! Or as though he went into the house, Leaned his hand on the wall, And a serpent bit him!
Is not the day of the LORD darkness, and not light? Is it not very dark, with no brightness in it?
“I (Is. 1:11-16; Amos 4:4, 5; 8:10) hate, I despise your feast days, And (Lev. 26:31; Jer. 14:12; Hos. 5:6) I do not savor your sacred assemblies.
(Is. 66:3; Mic. 6:6, 7) Though you offer Me burnt offerings and your grain offerings, I will not accept them, Nor will I regard your fattened peace offerings.
Take away from Me the noise of your songs, For I will not hear the melody of your stringed instruments.
(Jer. 22:3; Ezek. 45:9; Hos. 6:6; Mic. 6:8) But let justice run down like water, And righteousness like a mighty stream.
“Did (Deut. 32:17; Josh. 24:14; Neh. 9:18-21; Acts 7:42, 43) you offer Me sacrifices and offerings In the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
You also carried Sikkuth (1 Kin. 11:33) your king And Chiun, your idols, The star of your gods, Which you made for yourselves.
Therefore I will send you into captivity (2 Kin. 17:6; Amos 7:11, 17; Mic. 4:10) beyond Damascus,” Says the LORD, (Amos 4:13) whose name is the God of hosts.

Warnings to Zion and Samaria Woe (Luke 6:24) to you who are at (Ps. 123:4; Is. 32:9-11; Zeph. 1:12) ease in Zion, And (Is. 31:1; Jer. 49:4) trust in Mount Samaria, Notable persons in the (Ex. 19:5; Amos 3:2) chief nation, To whom the house of Israel comes!

(Jer. 2:10) Go over to (Gen. 10:10; Is. 10:9) Calneh and see; And from there go to (1 Kin. 8:65; 2 Kin. 18:34) Hamath the great; Then go down to Gath of the Philistines. (Nah. 3:8) Are you better than these kingdoms? Or is their territory greater than your territory?
Woe to you who (Is. 56:12; Ezek. 12:27; Amos 9:10; Matt. 24:37-39) put far off the day of (Amos 5:18) doom, (Amos 5:12) Who cause (Ps. 94:20) the seat of violence to come near;
Who lie on beds of ivory, Stretch out on your couches, Eat lambs from the flock And calves from the midst of the stall;
(Is. 5:12; Amos 5:23) Who sing idly to the sound of stringed instruments, And invent for yourselves (1 Chr. 15:16; 16:42) musical instruments (1 Chr. 23:5) like David;
